definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: He hunted his pet dog out of his house.
At midnight he would interrupt his work and prepare the food for his dog Blondi.
sentences.chinese: 深夜，他會中斷工作去爲他的愛犬準備食物。

sentences.english: It must be that Lü Dongbin's pet dog bit him.
sentences.chinese: 肯定是呂洞賓的愛犬咬了他一口。

sentences.english: Offering Pomme's delicious snacks to your beloved Pets.
sentences.chinese: 爲你的愛犬提供美味的零食。

sentences.english: My dog nosed game out in a cave.
sentences.chinese: 我的愛犬嗅出了一個洞內有獵物。

sentences.english: The best advice for a dog who is misbehaving is to increase his exercise.
sentences.chinese: 擁有大庭院並不等於愛犬的運動量就足夠了。

sentences.english: The statue of the couple's beloved dog reminds them of him.
sentences.chinese: 這對夫妻的愛犬的雕像讓他們睹物思人。

sentences.english: Is this the project of a madman?
sentences.chinese: 唯一的目擊者，卻是女人的愛犬羅莉。

sentences.english: Owned by the Small Nun, it is the guardian of the nunnery's vegetable garden.
sentences.chinese: 小尼姑之愛犬，負責看守靜修庵之菜園。
你的愛犬越來越發福嗎？

sentences.english: Maple fruit contains more easily absorbed calcium, promoting bone health of dogs.
sentences.chinese: 楓樹果露中更易吸收的高鈣，促進愛犬骨骼健康。

sentences.english: Any of my dog’s sad eyes always stirs the fervor in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 愛犬悲傷的眼神總會激起我心中的熱情。

sentences.english: He put a fishing pole on his shoulder. His dogs were running after him.
sentences.chinese: 他肩上扛着魚杆，愛犬在後面跟隨。

sentences.english: That way, your dog will be less active during the day.
sentences.chinese: 那樣一來，您的愛犬在白天時就不會那麼好動。

sentences.english: My family actually has a dog, Carver, that we named after him.
sentences.chinese: 我家裏就有一隻愛犬，就是以卡弗命名的。

sentences.english: He was watching his dog, Luna, as she tried to chew a piece of bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 當時他在觀察他的愛犬露娜使勁咬着一片竹子。

definition: to issue a document/document issued by an authority/outgoing messages/(Internet) to post an article online
to start out on a trip/to dispatch troops
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
